poem:
Title: Upon Morning's Newsprint

Through the blurred ink of world affairs,
strikes and warnings weave a heavy tapestry,
Yet the morning bird trills unscathed by what it hears,
both the olive branch and threat, peace or catastrophe.
Beijing, Washington, threads spun round the earth's equator,
Diplomats, like poets too, must weigh their words in gold -
A dance of tongues, a call for quiet contemplator.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Israel warns it will hit back if Iran strikes as US issues travel restrictions for diplomats 9.46am BST China urged the US to play “a constructive role” in the Middle East on Friday after its top diplomat Wang Yi spoke with his US counterpart Antony Blinken over the phone, reports Agence France-Presse (AFP). According to the report by AFP, Blinken used the call to ask Beijing to use its influence to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
